Hari Maia.title: Outer Space
Hari Maia.about: "Outer Space" is an immersive, cinematic journey inspired by classic film scores and pioneers of electronic music like Tangerine Dream and Vangelis. Blending lush analog synth textures, evolving arpeggios, and atmospheric soundscapes, the track evokes the feeling of a futuristic dreamscape, perfect for late-night drives or deep introspection. With a strong storytelling element, this piece bridges the gap between retro-futurism and modern cinematic electronica. It has already been resonating with synthwave and soundtrack enthusiasts, gaining organic traction on Bandcamp and niche electronic music communities. A perfect fit for playlists that explore deep, evocative, and atmospheric electronic music.

Hari Maia.title: Separation
Hari Maia.about: "Separation" is a collaboration between Hari Maia and Morning Haze. We're providing you all 3 versions of the song: Original Version, Full Speech and Instrumental. I really hope you guys enjoy it!

Hari Maia.title: We're Not Humans Anymore
Hari Maia.about: "We're Not Humans Anymore" is a song made by thoughts of a futuristic world dominated by machines. A world where the humankind were annihilated. It has a huge Sci-Fi concept. Musically speaking, this track has beautiful synthesizer melodies and sad at the same time. Very atmospheric, space drone. It's a beautifully sad song.

Hari Maia.title: Deep Space Ocean
Hari Maia.about: "Deep Space Ocean" blends serene ambient textures with a hypnotic synth melody, evoking a dreamlike, meditative state. Inspired by Tangerine Dream’s cinematic soundscapes but with a calmer, more introspective approach, it drifts through evolving pads and delicate arpeggios. Perfect for deep relaxation, sleep, and liminal spaces, this track offers a timeless, immersive experience for ambient and meditation playlists.

Hari Maia.title: Universalis
Hari Maia.about:
Link Bandcamp album:  cyclicaldreams.bandcamp.com/album/universalis-cyd-0135



 Cyclical Dreams (Record Label) 

cyclicaldreams.bandcamp.com



 CD Edition:  Kunaki.com/Sales.asp?PID=PX00K4MHO8&PP=1



 About the album:



"Universalis" is an album of soundscapes that evoke an intergalactic journey.

The compositions began on a beautiful cold and rainy day, conditions that often inspire my creative process and are typically the most conducive to composing music for me. From that starting point, I developed a narrative for an imaginary sci-fi film, something I truly enjoy doing with most, if not all, of my musical works. "Universalis" is no exception.

It represents a voyage into the vast, unknown, and mysterious realms of outer space, a sonic exploration of the cosmos through an imagined cinematic lens.

The idea behind "Universalis" was to create a soundtrack for something as wondrous, magical, and full of secrets as the universe itself. I’ve always been passionate about the cosmos and its magnitude, and this fascination is reflected throughout the album’s eight tracks.

To bring this vision to life, I recorded and performed a wide range of synthesizers, aiming to emulate “the sound of space”. In doing so, I drew inspiration from many of the artists I admire, such as Tangerine Dream, Vangelis, Brian Eno, and many others.



All tracks recorded in 2025.

Music Composed, Arranged, Performed & Produced by Hari Maia.

Mixed & Mastered by Hari Maia.

Instruments used: Arp Odyssey, B-3, Buchla Easel, Casio CZ, CMI, DX7, Jun-6, Jup-8, Korg MS-20, Matrix-12, Mellotron, Minimoog, OP-Xa, Solina (these from Arturia V Collection).

Hardware: Korg Volca Keys, Arturia KeyLab 49.

Audio Interface: Focusrite 2i4.



released June 27, 2025



Artwork: Cyclical Dreams

Photography: Amp Puttipong

fb: amp.puttipong

Hari Maia.title: Blackened Horizon
Hari Maia.about:
"Blackened Horizon" is a concept record, as Hari Maia's first album "Haunted Place". This one follows the same approach but darker and dramatic. The imaginated story from "Blackened Horizon" is basically about a post-apocalypitic world where people were left behind, just a few survived the unnatural disaster events.



"Blackened Horizon" is a good trip for those who want to deep dive into introspection and self-discovery, but maybe the end may not be that good.

trackinfo.title: The World Paralyzed For A While

Hari Maia.title: The Endless Hum
Hari Maia.about:
Music has a way of operating between a zone of both reflection and description. It offers a unique sensory canvas upon which both experience and imagination can co-exists, even in the same moment.



For Brazilian musician Hari Maia, this porous surface is the setting for his latest edition The Endless Hum. Here Maia charts a fluid cascade of sound that speaks to and perhaps even describes the moments of anxiety and relief that orbit us in our daily lives. 



This record charts out a contoured (but varying) path through the uncertain terrains of now. It is both a guide to these unsteady moments and a cure for them. It offers a thread of continuity that is born out in its long form features. 



Like our days, this is a music of arrival and departure, a music of fluidity in time and place. It recurs, but even in its recurrence its form and experience are never set, but rather reflect back to us where we are, how we are feeling and perhaps even offers us a tow line out of the darker moments of our times.
Hari Maia.credits:
released May 30, 2025
            
            This is a Guide To Saints edition

Written and produced by Hari Maia

Mastered by Lawrence English at Negative Space

Cover photograph by Lawrence English

trackinfo.title: No Signal, No Answer, Pt. I
No Signal, No Answer, Pt. II

Hari Maia.title: Home
Hari Maia.about: "Home" has an overall optimistic inspired by sci-fi movies soundtrack. This song is made by analog synthesizers from 80s which brings the listener a sense of nostalgic energy.

Hari Maia.title: Vanish
Hari Maia.about:
"It's a 4 track EP full of smooth atmospheres, ethereal melodies and an overall nostalgic analog tape sound. My goal with this new EP "Vanish" was making something angelical and distant.



I always imagine something while composing because it let me create a soundtrack for what I'm creating in my mind. 



This EP is about the sense of deep meditations gives, sometimes, the sense of levitating, transcending or vanishing."

Hari Maia.title: Inside The Woods - Orchestral Version (From Haunted Place)
Hari Maia.about:
"Haunted Place" is turning 2 years old today, so, for celebrate this, I composed a orchestral version of one of the tracks from the album, the chosen one was: "Inside the Woods". It's a very special to me, because was one of the first songs I composed for the album



The album idea was making a soundtrack for an imaginary horror/thriller film. It was the first experience to me, as a composer, scoring for a film, even if it doesn't exist.

trackinfo.title: Inside The Woods - Orchestral Version (From Haunted Place)

Hari Maia.title: Máquina Hiper-Real
Hari Maia.about:
Hari Maia: 

"O processo de composição das músicas do EP, com aforismos do querido Edgar Franco (Ciberpajé) , começou logo após a audição de todos os 5 que foram enviados para mim. No momento surgiram várias ideias de timbres e sonoridades, que inclusive conversamos bastante sobre. Ele comentou que gostava de algo feito com sintetizadores e timbres futuristas. Foi como uma peça que se encaixou perfeitamente na outra, pois a maioria do que eu produzo contém o uso de sintetizadores.

Os aforismos foram inspiradores para a composição da trilha e dos temas, pois de acordo com o que era dito por ele, com o tom de voz que usava, em determinados momentos, surgiam ideias de uma música tensa, ou uma música mais esperançosa, resultando no EP: "Máquina Hiper-Real" com 5 faixas."

-

Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco): 

""Máquina Hiper-real" surpreendeu o Ciberpajé pela força da tessitura e das atmosferas sonoras criadas por Hari Maia que casaram perfeitamente com a proposta conceitual dos aforismos. E essas atmosferas densas inspiraram também na criação da arte de capa e projeto gráfico do EP."

trackinfo.title: Aforismo 1: Pura Perfeição
trackinfo.lyrics:
"Para a profunda essência cósmica não existem erros.
Tudo é parte da perfeição da existência, os atos de compaixão mais luminosos, e mesmo os atos de ódio mais hediondos.
Não existe nenhum julgamento, nenhuma escolha, tudo é o que é, e por ser assim é pura perfeição."
-
Por: Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco)

trackinfo.title: Aforismo 2: O Amor É Sempre A Meta
trackinfo.lyrics:
"O amor é sempre a meta, mesmo para os que se exasperam de ódio por não serem amados."
-
Por: Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco)

trackinfo.title: Aforismo 3: A Lua Esplendorosa
trackinfo.lyrics:
"Ter alguém para ouvir-nos em momentos de angústia faz uma enorme diferença, mesmo que esse alguém seja a Lua esplendorosa e luminosa, observando-nos em silêncio."
-
Por: Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco)

trackinfo.title: Aforismo 4: A Criação Genuína
trackinfo.lyrics:
"Não tema nunca o que os outros vão pensar do que você criar, seja livre, leve e intenso. Jamais ouça os freios estéreis da razão, não deixe a mente silenciar seu coração, pois tudo que é verdadeiramente criativo e vivo surge do coração. A mente repleta de teorias e conhecimento pode tornar-se um crivo para a criação, agindo como censor a todo momento, questionando as inspirações puras e os insights, por isso quando for criar, desvencilhe-se de todas as teorias, jogue todo o conhecimento prévio no lixo, torne-se puro e inocente como uma criança. Só assim surge a criação genuína."
-
Por: Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco)

trackinfo.title: Aforismo 5: A Máquina Do Lucro
trackinfo.lyrics:
"Lembram-se de como eram as nossas manhãs? Nos trópicos o sol brilhava majestoso e era ignorado por quase todos. Turbas de seres robotizados seguindo hipnotizados para seus trabalhos, repetindo a mesma rotina entediante de suas vidas sem sentido, esperando o fim do expediente para terem tempo de exercerem seu único direito, o de consumirem avidamente e se empanturrarem de lixos entorpecentes como TV, Internet, álcool, açúcar, deus e futebol.
Nesse mundo desconectado da natureza o egocentrismo ampliava-se exponencialmente, a empatia morria. Os ciclos seguiam incólumes, o lixo aumentando, a destruição da biosfera crescendo. A chegada da grande pandemia parou por instantes o movimento secular, mas os robôs desesperados estão insanos e ávidos para retomarem a sua pseudo normalidade alienada e doentia. Os robôs de carne apodrecida. E a máquina pós-hiper-real do lucro não pode parar, ela é mais valiosa que a vida, que a morte, que a biosfera, e os autômatos mesmerizados devem retomar seus grilhões. Enquanto isso, no olho destruído do Cerrado, o glorioso Sol da manhã brilha a cada dia mais quente. Ele torrará os corpos e fritará as almas de todos nós, majestosamente!"
-
Por: Ciberpajé (Edgar Franco)

Hari Maia.title: BOTH SIDES

Hari Maia.title: Gravitational Attraction
Hari Maia.about: Also available on all streaming services -  biglink.to/HariMaia

Hari Maia.title: Haunted Place
Hari Maia.about:
For this record I had strong influences from horror and thriller movies. I like to imagine myself in the situation of the characters in danger or feeling that something bad is coming. 



Thinking about a song for these themes was not so complicated because I am fan of horror movies and I listen to a lot of composers like: Ben Frost, The Newton Brothers, master John Carpenter, Daniel Davies and others. They made soundtrack for amazing movies and series, which I had a strong influence on.
Hari Maia.credits:
released May 17, 2020
            
            Art-cover by: Rafael Rocha

Hari Maia.title: Distant Fields
Hari Maia.about:
"Distant Fields" was recorded during the 2020 pandemic period. Here in Rio, these are times that we are still facing today and very little has shifted for the better from where we were this time last year. I decided to record this music both for me and also to help my friends relax and travel a little bit through the melodies and atmospheres, if not through their bodies. It’s a music for motion, for internal travel and for expanding the spaces around us.



This work was my first time experimenting with a little synth, the Korg Volca Keys. I also recorded numerous domestic objects that had an interesting sound. I think like a lot of us, I was spending so much time inside that everything around me became a potential sound source - something I could maybe get a sound from or use as a source material in some way.



When I'm composing I like the idea of thinking about a place, or creating a narrative in a place I imagine, so in this way "Distant Fields” is not so different or me. I am wanting us to reach out together into this other place, maybe we don’t go to the same place, but we go somewhere together and in those moments we find ourselves decompressing from the inside out and expanding the spaces within ourselves.
Hari Maia.credits:
released April 2, 2021
            
            This Is A Guide To Saints Edition

trackinfo.title: When It Finally Ends (There Will Be A New Beginning)

Hari Maia.title: Duas Coxinhas (Original Soundtrack)

Hari Maia.title: The Answer To All Your Questions (Main Theme)
Hari Maia.about: The answer to all of our inner questions is not always exactly what we expected. Yes, it can surprise you.

trackinfo.title: The Answer To All Your Questions (Main Theme)

Hari Maia.title: Olson (Boards Of Canada Cover)
Hari Maia.about: Boards of Canada has been a great inspiration to me when producing and composing a song. I couldn't leave out the possibility of producing a cover of this amazing duo. So here is a tribute that I produced with love and admiration for the quality, creativity and originality of the Boards of Canada duo.

Hari Maia.title: A Warm Place (Nine Inch Nails Cover)
Hari Maia.about: I made a cover of the track "A Warm Place" by Nine Inch Nails to express my love for this song and I would love to hear from you what you guys think about this one. Give me that support, sharing with your friends and fans of the band, in case you like it. Thanks a lot!

trackinfo.title: A Warm Place (Nine Inch Nails Cover)

Hari Maia.title: Upside Down
Hari Maia.about:
I made this track in honor the series Stranger Things. I thought about the main theme (opening theme), and did this song under influence of the main theme. Kind of a song that could be used in the series. Maybe.

This express my love for the moogs, synths and of course, the series Stranger Things!!
